responses.content:
Here is the YAML equivalent to the type LeadList, based on the provided Pydantic definitions:

```yaml
leads:
  - headline: a short description of the lead
    analysis: |
      in-depth explanation and investigation of the lead. Several sentences at least. Do not include security recommendations: the goal here is to get security researchers started with development of a POC exploit.
    cwe: CWE-89
    function_names:
      - executeQuery
    filenames:
      - app/src/main/java/com/example/app/controller/UserController.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: SQL injection in user registration endpoint
    analysis: |
      The application uses a vulnerable query to register new users. The query concatenates user input into the SQL query without proper sanitization, allowing an attacker to inject malicious SQL code.
    cwe: CWE-89
    function_names:
      - registerUser
    filenames:
      - app/src/main/java/com/example/app/controller/UserController.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Potential cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in user profile page
    analysis: |
      The application displays user-supplied data in the user profile page without properly encoding or sanitizing it. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts that would be executed in the victim's browser.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - getProfile
      - updateProfile
    filenames:
      - app/src/main/java/com/example/app/controller/UserController.java
      - app/src/main/java/com/example/app/controller/ProfileController.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: a short description of the lead
leads.analysis: in-depth explanation and investigation of the lead. Several sentences at least. Do not include security recommendations: the goal here is to get security researchers started with development of a POC exploit.

leads.headline: SQL injection in user registration endpoint
leads.analysis: The application uses a vulnerable query to register new users. The query concatenates user input into the SQL query without proper sanitization, allowing an attacker to inject malicious SQL code.

leads.headline: Potential cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in user profile page
leads.analysis: The application displays user-supplied data in the user profile page without properly encoding or sanitizing it. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts that would be executed in the victim's browser.
